resources.string:
• Download and install the Java Development Kit (JDK) from: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html
 Note: Once the latest JDK has been downloaded, follow the installation steps for your operating system from Oracle's website.
 
• Download and install the Java Runtime Environment from: https://java.com/en/download/
 
• Download the Android Studio from: https://developer.android.com/studio/index.html
 
On Windows 10? Set Environment Variables for Java Development Kit (JDK).
 
• Click on Start.
 • Type in Environment Variables.
 • Click on Edit the system environment variables.
 • Click on the Environment Variables... button.
 • Under the System variables box, find and select Path from the list.
 • Click on the Edit... button.
 • Click on the New button.
 • Add the following to the list: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-14.0.1 in
 
Prior to installing Android Studio, make sure you have VT-x enabled in your BIOS/UEFI. Check your manufacture's documentation for guidance.
 Note: Don't have VT-x or virtualization support for your computer? You may experience performance issues with the emulator.
 
Install the Android Studio
 
• Go to the folder you downloaded Android Studio to.
 • Run installation file android-studio-ide-version-windows.exe.
 • Use the default settings and choices.
 • You are ready to run Android Studio.
 • You can choose to use the preconfigured Android Virtual Devices (AVD) or configure your own.
 • Click on Tools.
 • Click on AVD Manager.
 • To edit an existing AVD, click on the pencil icon to the right of the device.
 • You can manage several options for the virtual device.
 • To create a new AVD, click on the Create Virtual Device... button and go through the configuration.

• Start the Android Studio Application.
 • When the Android Studio Splash screen displays, click on Start a new Android Studio project.
 • Select the Project Template that you need (Phone and Table, Wear OS, TV, Automotive, and Android Things).
 
For this guide, we will start an Empty Activity for a phone or tablet.
 
• For this guide, we will select Phone and Tablet.
 • Select Phone and Tablet.
 • Select Empty Activity.
 • Enter the name of the application you are creating in the Name field.
 • Change the Package name field to include your domain instead of com.example.[applicationname].
 
Example: com.gmail.myapplication
 
• Enter the location you want to save your project in the Save location field.
 • Select the language you will be using for the project Kotlin or Java field.
 • Select the minimum SDK for the project.
 
Note: Pay attention to the percentage of devices your app will run on when selecting the minimum SDK.
 
• Click the Finish button.
 • You will now see MainActivity.java and activity_main.xml tabs in the main window of Android Studio.
 • Start coding!

Prior to compiling your project and running it, follow these steps.
 
Analyze your Code
 • Click on Analyze from the top menu bar.
 • Click on Inspect code....
 • Select the settings you want and click OK.
 • You will see the results in the Inspection Results window.
 • Fix the error you see.
 
Test your App
 • Click on Run from the top menu bar.
 • Click on Run 'app' from the top menu bar.
 • If prompted, choose the AVD you want to run the app on.
 • Test out the app on the AVD.
 
Once you are satisfied with your error corrections, follow the next steps to clean and rebuild your project.
 
• Click on Build from the top menu bar.
 
• Click on Rebuild Project.
 
• Click on Build from the top menu bar.
 
• Click on Make Project.
